trans-unit.source: Protect a file on a device (protect in-place) by using the Rights Management sharing application
trans-unit.target: Protect a file on a device (protect in-place) by using the Rights Management sharing application

trans-unit.source: When you protect a file in-place, it replaces the original, unprotected file.
trans-unit.target: When you protect a file in-place, it replaces the original, unprotected file.

trans-unit.source: You can then leave the file where it is, copy it to another folder or device, or share the folder that it is in and the file will remain protected.
trans-unit.target: You can then leave the file where it is, copy it to another folder or device, or share the folder that it is in and the file will remain protected.

trans-unit.source: You could also attach the protected file to an email message, although the recommended way to share a protected file by email is directly from File Explorer or an Office application (see <link><linkText>Protect a file that you share by email by using the Rights Management sharing application</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You could also attach the protected file to an email message, although the recommended way to share a protected file by email is directly from File Explorer or an Office application (see <link><linkText>Protect a file that you share by email by using the Rights Management sharing application</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you see any errors when you try to protect files, refer to <link><linkText>FAQ for Microsoft Rights Management Sharing Application for Windows</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you see any errors when you try to protect files, refer to <link><linkText>FAQ for Microsoft Rights Management Sharing Application for Windows</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To protect a file on a device (protect in-place)
trans-unit.target: To protect a file on a device (protect in-place)

trans-unit.source: In File Explorer, select a file to protect.
trans-unit.target: In File Explorer, select a file to protect.

trans-unit.source: Right-click, select Protect with RMS, and then select Protect in-place.
trans-unit.target: Right-click, select Protect with RMS, and then select Protect in-place.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: If you do not see the Protect with RMS option, it’s likely that either the RMS sharing application is not installed on your computer, or your computer must be restarted to complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: If you do not see the Protect with RMS option, it’s likely that either the RMS sharing application is not installed on your computer, or your computer must be restarted to complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to install the RMS sharing application, see <link><linkText>Download and install the Rights Management sharing application</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to install the RMS sharing application, see <link><linkText>Download and install the Rights Management sharing application</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Select a policy template: These are predefined permissions that typically restrict access and usage to people in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Select a policy template: These are predefined permissions that typically restrict access and usage to people in your organization.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your organization name is "Contoso, Ltd", you might see Contoso, Ltd - Confidential View Only.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your organization name is "Contoso, Ltd", you might see Contoso, Ltd - Confidential View Only.

trans-unit.source: If this is the first time you have protected a file on this computer, you will first need to select Company-defined Protection to download the templates.
trans-unit.target: If this is the first time you have protected a file on this computer, you will first need to select Company-defined Protection to download the templates.

trans-unit.source: The next time you click the Protect in-place option, you will see up to 10 templates to choose from.
trans-unit.target: The next time you click the Protect in-place option, you will see up to 10 templates to choose from.

trans-unit.source: If there are more than 10 templates available and the one you want isn’t displayed, click Company-defined Protection to download and see all the templates.
trans-unit.target: If there are more than 10 templates available and the one you want isn’t displayed, click Company-defined Protection to download and see all the templates.

trans-unit.source: When you select a policy template, you can also protect multiple files and a folder.
trans-unit.target: When you select a policy template, you can also protect multiple files and a folder.

trans-unit.source: When you select a folder, all the files in that folder are automatically selected for protection but new files that you create in that folder will not be automatically protected.
trans-unit.target: When you select a folder, all the files in that folder are automatically selected for protection but new files that you create in that folder will not be automatically protected.

trans-unit.source: Select Custom Permissions: Choose this option if the templates don’t provide the level of protection that you need or you want to explicitly set the protection options yourself.
trans-unit.target: Select Custom Permissions: Choose this option if the templates don’t provide the level of protection that you need or you want to explicitly set the protection options yourself.

trans-unit.source: Specify the options that you want for this file in the add protection dialog box, and then click Apply.
trans-unit.target: Specify the options that you want for this file in the add protection dialog box, and then click Apply.

trans-unit.source: You might quickly see a dialog box to tell you that the file is being protected, and the focus then returns to File Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You might quickly see a dialog box to tell you that the file is being protected, and the focus then returns to File Explorer.

trans-unit.source: The selected file or files are now protected.
trans-unit.target: The selected file or files are now protected.

trans-unit.source: In some cases (when adding protection changes the file name extension), the original file in File Explorer is replaced with a new file that has the Rights Management protection lock icon.
trans-unit.target: In some cases (when adding protection changes the file name extension), the original file in File Explorer is replaced with a new file that has the Rights Management protection lock icon.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: If you later need to remove protection from a file, see <link><linkText>Remove protection from a file by using the Rights Management sharing application</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you later need to remove protection from a file, see <link><linkText>Remove protection from a file by using the Rights Management sharing application</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.target: Examples and other instructions
